Content.Title: Who am I?
Content: I'm a Cambridge educated Mathematician and a self taught programmer currently looking for work.
Mathematics.ninja is a website that was built, styled and deployed by me.
When starting this project I decided to focus on the stylistic elements, as I have quite an eye for style (certainly much more so than many of the mathematicians I have spent much of my time with).

Content.Title: Intention
Content: I decided to do this simply as an exercise to learn React.js as I had never used it before.
Then two weeks later I had a functioning website, which I'm still adding to.
Or: to which I am still adding, depending on your grammatical preferences.
I also intend to migrate a few of my previous more ambitious (often Python) endeavours into a web-friendly format and add them onto here.

Content.Title: Future
Content: They are mostly mathematical visualisations and ways to be more interactive with the "Black-Box" many I have spoken to are mystified by.
Some are my attempts to answer a question that I had (number crunching probabilistic expectations for example).
And a few more are ways for me to use my skills with mathematics and programming to create tools for my hobbies.
